text: <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is essential for constitutive and LPS - induced <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression .

( A ) Endogenous <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression is abrogated in <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - MEFs compared to <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + MEFs in the absence and presence of LPS .

qPCR analysis of murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression in untreated <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + and <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - MEFs , and after simulation with LPS ( 100 ng / ml ) for the indicated times .
( B ) Endogenous <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is abrogated in <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient inflammatory macrophages .
Thioglycollate - elicited peritoneal macrophages ( TG macs ) were infected with human and murine specific lentiviral shRNAs .
Human CEBPB shRNA serves as the non - silencing control since it does not target the murine <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sequence [ 38 ] .
Lentiviral transduced macrophages were stimulated with LPS ( 100 ng / ml ) for 4 hrs .
Left : Western blot analysis shows effective knockdown of endogenous <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> following infection with murine Cebpb shRNA and not human CEBPB shRNA .
Right : qPCR analysis of murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression in the lentiviral transduced peritoneal macrophages .
The results represent the mean and SEM of two independent experiments performed in duplicate or triplicate .
